page.title: 07TOTTON WESTERN BY-PASS
page.content: The Totton western by-pass is being built to allow traffic from the Waterside area to get to the motorway (M27) quickly and easily. It will cost two and a half million pounds to build and it will be two miles long. There are twelve companies involved in constructing it and it will have five roudabouts, two bridges, one subway and a calvert which will carry Bartley Water under the road. It is estimated that twelve thousand cars a day will use the road. The road will take ninety weeks to complete and it will be finished by December 1985. No one opposed the construction of the road and as yet no one has been seriously injured during the building. The building contractors did not have to demolish any buildings of any shape or size because it is being built on open fields and woodland.
